text:
Aroma: Strong citric fruits, mango.
Appearance: Dark ambar color with hazy sparkling liquid and white head.
Taste: Heavy bitterness with sour medium notes.
Palate: Medium body with oily texture and soft carbonation. Long strong bitter finish.
Overall: Great beer. Strong aroma and flavour. Well balanced.

33cl shared bottle at home from De Caigny, Belgium. Nose is fruity. Body is hazy rusty red, head is medium, cream white, creamy, mostly lasting, good lacing. Aroma is fruity, wheat malty, leaves. Medium sweet, light bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is long lasting fruity hoppy medium bittersweet, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Bit heavy, interesting, strong flavor, nice one.

Bottle from bierhandel. Orange to brown color. Thin persistent beige head. Medium body. Low to medium carbonation. Aroma and flavour is pine, resin, orange, hops, chili, mango, pineapple, ginger, yeast. Nice!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Imperial Red IPA? Mocna słodowość, solidne chmielenie, acz głównie na aromat.
KØLF 041116. Red -orange color with an off-white head. Aroma is hop, spices,malt. flavor is hop, spices, orange peel, citrus, yeast. Weird beer.

Bevuta in bottiglia, dal colore marrone con schiuma di media persistenza. Molto floreale e pungente. Il sapore è molto dolce, agrumato e speziato. Ben equilibrata.
 Corpo medio e consistenza oleosa. Molto buona

En effet, ça fait assez noël.
Plutôt épicée, nez bien rond, caramélisé et orangé.
Bouche plutôt équilibrée, pas mal dorange, dépices. Amertume modérée mais assez présente.

Ambra con ampia Schiuma biancastra. Al naso arancia, frutta esotica, frumento. Ottima Bevuta, corpo rotondo, alcol perfetto. Frumento, spezie, agrumi. Davvero eccellente anche se si allontana dalla semplice wit.
Mooie kleur. Aroma is zeer fris. In de smaak met ik vooral de red ale me teen toets zest.

33cl Bottle @ 2D2Dspuma Tienda, Barcelona, Spain.
Orange copper colour with a thick frothy white head.
Aroma is citrus, wheat, peach, spices.
Taste is wheat, citrus, herbs, grapefruit, pine.
Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Golden red-brown color, beige head. Fruity nose, honey, peach, spicy notes. Fruity taste, grapefruit, honey, spicy, hint of phenols, moderate bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 Troebel amber oranje, mooie kraag, ziet er goed uit. Ruikt lekker moutig, citrusfruitig met het moutige op de voorgrond. Smaak is een mooie combi van mout en citrusvruchten. Redelijk bitter. Best een volle smaak en een lekkere lange nasmaak. Goed spul.
Bottle at home. Nice orange colour (blend of a red and a wit beer), offwhite creamy head. Orange peel hoppy, resinous, spruce, caramel malty. Good body, lively carbonation.

Color ámbar oscuro, turbio, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarillento de tres dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación media tirando a alta. Aroma lupulado y maltoso, muy profundo. Sabor lupulado, muy amargo y seco. Más bien una Imperial IPA. No me dio más.
Hefetrübes dunkles Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig,süßlich, sehr fruchtig, Grapefruit, Bitterorange, Orangenschalen, leicht bitter.

Draft 0.33l at Samo Pivo Belgrade, Serbia. 30.12.2016. Pour it amber reddish color with small white head. Aroma caramel, orange zest, cinnamon, some other spices as well. Taste sweet fruity, caramel, some pinch of molasis, bitterish fruity finish, after taste hoppy as well, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, sticky, average carbonation, long finish. Good spice one!

Aroma - Pacific Northwest hops, orange, coriander, cinnamon, oak, and Belgian yeast.
Appearance - the body is a soft mahogany, and cloudy. The head is beige and 2+", and settles very slowly. Frothy lacing.
Taste - has a mix of coriander, candied sugar, caramel, Pacific Northwest hops, Belgian yeast, spice, and orange peel.
Palate - the body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is average, finish is astringent.

Bottle from Boxbeers - Color: hazy golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: hoppy and grassy domination with spicy hint. Taste: medium malt body, good spicy balance and finish fruity and hoppy. Good attenuation. OK. Aftertaste: wet bitterness, citrus OK.

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur cuivrée, légère mousse. Nez fort houblonné mentholé et herbes. Gout sucré, fruité, mentholé, herbes, épice (note poivre), avec forte amertume, fruitée zeste agrume, agrumes confites, note caramel. Bon corps, le tout bien rond et intense. Fin longue amere sur les herbes. Carrement nickel pour une witbier
Abottle pours hazy Amber with a off white head. Aroma of fruit, resin and some orange. Taste is spice, fruit and some caramel.
Botella 33cl Tercer Tiempo Tienda (Santander) Aroma a lupulo fresco y especias, muy buen sabor recordando casi mas a una cerveza fresca de verano que a una cerveza navideña, muy buena

Pours a deep amber color, frothy light tan head with medium bubbles. The aroma is really awesome and unique: very sweet (I believe is the curacao) and pungent (pine needles, green pepper skin) at the same time. I love it! The flavour is sweet up front, very floreal, sweet orange peel and then come the hops and a slight coriander presence that balance and dry the mouth. The alcohol is well hidden. Finish is bittersweet. Medium body and oily texture. I enjoyed it so much!

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2016 Cloudy amber-orange with a medium beige head. Hoppy aroma of tropical fruit, nuts, gooseberries, resin. Hop centric bitterrish taste, more sweet than sour. Smooth milky/creamy texture, no signs of excess alcohol. Lovely!

Bottle 33cl, a clear copper beer with huge head and good lacework. Nose is on spices, mint, medical stuff. Taste is very bitter and quite sweet. Aroma is on orange, pine, kind of ginger, very strong spice touch. Finish is again very sweet with pine and hops resin and intense bitterness, still medicinal notes.

75cl fles via Hoppy Brothers, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 8%
Uitgeschonken in Duvel glas

Uiterlijk: donkeroranje met grote witte schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: flink hoppige neus, fruitig als grapefruit, mango, goede bitter, zoetje van het fruit, bloemig

Conclusie: heerlijk hoppig kerstbiertje

Bottle. Pours hazy dark orange with large, frothy, white head, slowly diminishing. Aroma of orange peel, spices, peach and herbs. Taste is medium sweet, finishes light to medium bitter, fruity (peach), orange peel, spices, some grapefruit and pine needles. Medium body, medium carbonation. A bit too much spices. Overall very good and unusual Christmas beer.

Grüne Paprika, piney Hops und ein undefinierbarer Kräutertouch dominieren den angehaucht ledrigen Geruch. Interessant. Im Mund ein wahrhaft hopfenbitterer Genosse, dem die Orange und malzige Süße nicht fremd sind. Die verwendeten Kräuter gehen im Alphasäuretropicfruitwirbel fast ein bißchen unter. Trotzdem ein sehr aussagekräftiges Christmas Ale. Aber Wit !? Kaum, höchstens das etwas getreidig pelzige Mundgefühl weißt drauf hin. 0,33/40DKK. Bottle. Aus dem MIKKELLER Online Store. Lecker.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Weihnachtskalender von Mikkeller). Dunkles Rotorange mit wunderbarer Schaumkrone. Extrem gut ausgebautes Imperial Wit.
12oz bottle from Savor Growl: copper pour, orange tint. aroma of pleasant spice, wheat, caramel. taste are straw, orange peel, herbal, pine, little yeasty, pepper, cumin, grassy. oily palate.
Una barreja de Red i Wit, amb llúpol i crític. Una miqueta amarga al final.

330ml bottle bought at HK Brewcraft in Central.
Looks: Cloudy hazy amber red colour with a thin ring of yeast sediments; One and a half finger head with crumpety off-white foam which last for 4 minutes; Beautiful sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and sweet Ale malt, with strong lychee, jackfruits, canned peaches, honey, floral, sugar, resins, light pine, coriander and grass. Very pleasant!

Taste: Mid to strong sweet Ale malt, with strong orange peel, strong grapefruits, caramel, wheaty tartness, floral, strong molasses, pine, strong resins, spices, earth, biscuits, strong lemon, very strong bitter hops and grass. Wow!

Body: Mid to full body. Very slick and oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: Very rich Ale maltyness in a thick background, despite the presence of notable wheat and tartness. Strong West Coast hops dominates with fresh grapefruits, strong resin ooze, earth and pine, which enhances the already strong orange peels. Flowery and sweet with strong lemon to round. Excellent!

Hoppiness: Lychee, jackfruits, peaches, honey, floral, resins, and grass in nose. Strong grapefruits, floral, pine, strong resins, earth, strong lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness is very strong for a lasting, high astringent sweet-bitter malty finish.

After Taste: Quite Dry. Spicy malty and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: This is essentially a strong Red IPA to the extent that wheatyness could not wear down its rich and sweet maltyness. The tropical fruity oozy hoppiness coupled with loads of orange peels, good looks and finishing, its really something special for the season. Great stuff and Merry Xmas!

Hazy red and white head. Nose is slight citrus and some herbal hops. Malty is in the taste but still is orange peel significant and also some herbal hops. Yeast and wheat is also a character well worth noticing in the taste. Almost like a Dolly Parton wit/ale.
Taping on the Camelot pub,pours cloudy dark orange with a small white head,aroma is mild spices and slight yeasty,fruity aroma of hops,guite bitter.

Bue à la pression. Une Witbier de couleur ambrée/rouge, ça a de quoi intriguer. Bonne mousse, nez agréable plutôt sur le toffee, tout en douceur. En bouche cest full caramel mais sans lourdeur, tout en douceur, ça caresse délicatement les papilles. Amertume légère, houblons quasiment absents en terme de saveurs. Très chouette bière !
Hazy amber-reddish with a big white head. Aroma is coriander, lime and hops. Taste is lime, caramel and yeast
Tasting at 100 piv. Hazy Amber color with huge white head Aroma of wheat, citrus hops, some fruits. Taste, red fruits, spices, wheat, citrus hops, notes of honey. Very good.
Pours red with a foamy head. Aroma is spicy, cinnamon. Taste is a bit of bitter hops with a lingering candied orange peel finish. Its ok, nowt special.
Enyhén édeskés íz, fűszerekkel a háttérben. Szép narancsos, vagy talán már enyhén vöröses szín. Összetett, komplex harmonikusokkal. Jó sör!

330 ml bottle. Unclear reddish orange body with a medium sized, off-white head. Aroma malt and citric fruit with hint of caramel. Flavor is sweet malt, citric fruit, berries, Belgium spicy yeast and quite bitter. Medium body and good, fruity bitter aftertaste. Quite nice, but I also find it a bit out of balance.

Nez: Caramel, pin
Bouche: Maltée, caramel, amertume zeste dorange, pin, épicée, reste très longtemps en bouche
Excellente bière qui attaque sur le malt et qui finit avec une grosse amertume

Hazy buby-orange body, medium lasting white head. Aroma of orange peel, fruity easter, yeast, light spicy notes, light alcohol fusel. Flavours of orange peel, caramel, fruity easter, yeast, medium bitter backbone. Long warm fruity bitter finish. Smooth and creamy body, very pleasing, soft carbo.

Bottle at hopaholic. Deep red colour small white head. Nose is piney, strong cilantro. Taste is strong cilantro, light wheat. Light lingering bitter aftertaste. Cant really feel the red side but nice nonetheless.

Aroma: blood orange, coriander, caramel, mango
Taste: light bitter, caramel, citrus, coriander, spicy, orange

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with nice beige head. Aroma: caramel, cardemomm, cinnamon, hay and other herbs, ash, yeasty, pumpkin. Taste: lot of cardemom and other spices, spicy, dry, herbs. Medium body. To much everything in here for me.

backlog, Bottle, hazy and cloudy red color with a smaller white head. Nose and flavor were christmas tree, caramel, toffee, nutmeg, coriander, floral hops and holiday fruit cake. Medium to fuller body.

Pours an amber-copper colour, with a big off white head that lasts all the while, leaving a small irregular lace. Aroma is earthy, with cloves, corianer, caramel, resine. Medium body, creamy palate and normal carbonation. Taste of bitter almonds, cloves, coriander, spices, oranges. Bitter finish. Really good.

0,33l bottle at home. BB 10/08/2019. copper / redish clear color, rather big off-white head. smells parfumy, herbal, spices, some yeast, bit doughy. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of exotic fruits, herbs, spices, light dough, light peach, some yeast. finishes light to medium bitter with some exotic fruits, peach and spices. quite nice enjoyable beer, greatg balance.
Tåkete brun med høyt beige tykt skum som ligger. Lukter appelsinskall, noe røde bær og sitrus. Bye bitterhet, sitrusskall og grape. Lang. Ikke noe typisk witbier, hadde lett godtatt denne som IPA.
Aroma is hops, spices, malts and alcohol. The flavor is malts, spices, citrus/fruit, hops and a bitter/warming alcohol finish.
Very decent and a cool take on a Christmas beer. Sort of sweet, fruity, slightly funky, estery. Fairly low carbonation.
Bottle. Unclear, reddish-amber color, white foam. Sweet aroma of malt, caramel, fruit, a little yeast. Taste: sweet, citrus, fruit, malt, a little yeast, spices, grapefruit.
Bottle. Red copper color. Aroma of amber malt, caramel, yeast and piney hop. Taste has creamy yeasty caramel, amber malt, oat, bitter piney hop and some herbs. Bit simple.

Punertavan ruskea olut paksulla valkoisella, pitkään kestävällä ja pitsiä jättävällä vaahdolla. Tuoksu hyvin IPAmainen, eksoottista hedelmää ja havuisuutta. Maku karamellisen makea ja eksoottisen hedelmäinen sekä havuinen. Ei tämä kyllä witbieriä ole nähnytkään.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 Taster at Mikkeller Seoul. Aroma is sweet and grassy and theres lots of caramel for the tongue. This is more like a Belgian ale than a wheat beer; Im not sure I taste any wheat at all. Its really quite good though.

Piana obfita, kremowa, trwała, przypominająca bitą śmietanę. Barwa czerwono bursztynowa, mętna. Aromat intensywny, przyjemny - są czerwone owoce w typie porzeczki, żurawiny, jarzębiny, do tego odrobina pomarańczy i świerku. W smaku podobnie - lekko kwaskowe, żywiczne, owocowe, z fajną pszeniczną podstawą słodową i karmelem. Goryczka średnia, ziołowo kolendrowa. Wysycenie średnie do niskiego, kremowe, lepkie, z nieźle ukrytym alkoholem.
Podsumowując trzeba przyznać, że piwu zdecydowanie bliżej do Red Ale niż do Witbiera. Motyw czerwonych owoców i sporej słodowości gra tu pierwsze skrzypce.
Un cervezón único, un estilo complicado llevado a la perfección. Su aroma y su sabor son tan sólo superados por su apariencia. Obligatoria!

Bottle
Aroma-orange, lemon, coriander, caramel
Appearance-ruby, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Draught at Mikkeller&Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy orange/amber beer with a nice lasting beige head. Hoppy perfume aroma, grassy, hay, citrus, caramel aroma. Hoppy caramel flavor, citrus, hay, bready notes. Kinda unclean.

Hazy, ruby colour with big fluffy head. Very nice lacing. Strong aroma of caramel, citrus fruits (lots of orange), some sweet exotic fruits, resinous note, hint of spices and belgian yeast on background. Fantastic at nose. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, over medium bitter and slighlty spicy. Long duration finish (very sweet on the beginning and light bitter on finish). Well hidden alcohol. Medium to full body. Medium carbonation. Awesome mix of red ale and belgian wit. Absolutely worth to try it!
Amber coloured and unclear. Has a white head, medium duration Heavy sweet aroma and flavor. Lightly perfumed

My 700th beer: 330ml bottle from Gallaghers Beer World/El Irlandés. Pours a hazy but beautiful orange color and a nice medium off-white (with yellowish hues) head that leaves a fine cap. Aroma is hoppy, spicy and fruity. Spicy hops integrate well into a backbone of coriander, curacao and orange peel notes. Hints of grapefruit but especially herbs, melon, pears and some peaches. Wonderful though not too intense. Taste is perfectly balanced. Mellow bitter profile but with high amounts of fruitiness that gives sweet hints and discreet tart touches. Quite intense, flavorful AND harmonious. Spiciness gives some extra edge. Layered. Great! Medium body, high carbonation. A bit of alcoholic kick, mostly in the finish. Aftertaste gives ripe fruits as a last reward. Yeah, its a bit off-style, too strong and intense, but its fantastic as is. Overall an unexpectedly fine Christmas Ale, multidimensional and chracterful. It deserves high marks.

Bottle, dark orange to light brown unclear color with huge beige head, malty backbone with wheat freshness, zesty and citrusy, little bit spicy, nice hoppy aroma with pines, well carbonated, long bitter finish with unbelievable palate, very tasty

bottle at home from the winerackfull bodied and heavy, ester rich at first but on standing corriander and orange peel comes through a bit more, quite dubbel-like with rich dried fruit sweetness and too heavy/sweet for me

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A wonderful sparkling red brown mahogany opaque beer ; thin bubbles ; big off-white foamy head ; good retention and lacing. Fruits (orange, lime, tropical fruits), resin, light alcohol, caramel, roast, light coriander. Medium to heavy dry bitter refreshing, light sweet, light warming. Medium body, medium oily texture, average carbonation, dry fruity bitter lasting finish. Overall, a great twilight look ; nice fruity bitterness ; refreshing. I enjoyed the play-on-word with the name of the beer. Nevertheless, no Christmas spirit in this bottle.

Bottle 330ml @ My parents place
Pours hazy copper with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, orange, wheat and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long orange, caramel and bitter finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle. Hazy amber body with white head. Aroma is fruity with some herbs. Taste is nearly the same but with more spices. Aftertaste is spices with some bitterness
Big bottle 1.5 l. Amber with white head. Hoppy aroma, sweet malty flavour with orange peel hints, light bitter finish
Big ass bottle 1500ml. Smells fruity and tastes fruity with a slight bitterness. Awesome!!
33 cl @ bottle. Ibrido particolare Fra Blanche e unambrata. Molto beverina. Birra di natale atipica.
Pours hazy deep gold into a tulip. Sour caramel aromas. Medium bodied with mild sour pit fruit and an earthy finish.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 Bottle. Hazy amber coloured with big white head. Hoppy aroma of citrus, fresh fruit and pine. In mouth aroma of orange and bitter orange-peel. Flavours starts sweet but finish bitter.

Az IPA bár igen közkedvelt stílus, ünnepi italként kevesen tekintenek rá, ezért is olyan különleges, amikor karácsonyi verzió kerül belőle az asztalra. A Mikkeller főzete nem a megszokott, túlfűszerezett téli vonalat képviseli, a réz színű ital egy tartalmas india pale ale jellemvonásait ölti annak trópusi gyümölcsös, fenyős, karamellás karakterét előtérbe helyezve, melyhez egy narancshéjas, üde és aromás hangulat társul, némi belga tripeles korinaderes levezetéssel. Fűszeresség hiányában tehát semmi esetre sincs a sör, a búzasörökre jellemző élénk, pikánsan csípőskés jelleg is könnyedén felfedezhető benne. Jóleső, tartalmas kesernye tereli egybe a gyümölcsös jegyeket, kerekre szabott ital benyomását keltve a komlóbarát közönség számára.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a hazy orange colour pour with beige head. Fresh aroma, fruity and slightly estery. Taste of an amber ale, quite bitter and hoppy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(330ml bottle shared @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Dec 15 2015) Aroma of bitter orange peel, citrus juice, sweet pale pit fruit, slightly bready caramel malt, floral hops, a little yeast character with spicy phenolics. Fairly sweet malt core at first with caramel, orange, pale pit/tropical fruit notes, bitterness builds with orange peel, floral hops, slightly spicy, a little toast to the malt. Finish is medium bitter, orange peel, hops with citrus and slight pine, light roast. Fairly full bodied and rich, above average carb, more a red ale than a wit. Nice orange flavours from additions and hops, good balance with malt sweetness, warming but not overbearing winter beer. Good stuff.

Butelka 0,33 Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, piana słaba trzyma się długo na szkle. Aromat owocowy a także sosna i karmel Smak owocowy, wytrawny, na podniebieniu gorzki, nieokreślone przyprawy i zioła. Zbyt intensywne.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Hazy orange pour with beige head. Really nice, fresh aroma, fruity and slightly estery. Taste leans towards an amber ale, quite bitter and hoppy. Overall its an interesting blend but definitely heavier on the amber ale flavor profile.

Bottle at home. The color is mahogany with a huge khaki head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, caramel, mango and leather. The flavor has more pine, grapefruit and some spices. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body and a medium bitterness. Well-balanced and lots of American hops in this ale.

Bottled:Pours hazy reddish brown with a large, fluffy head. Sweet, malty aroma with notes of salty licorice and dried fruit. Flavour is more sweet malt and salty licorice. Theres also some hops and some light roastiness leading to a bitter finish.Pretty good!

Bottle. Pours hazy reddish light brown with huge offwhite creamy head. Aroma is passion fruit, orange, pomelo, dried hops, spruce and malt syrup. Taste is medium sweet, medium to very bitter and light acidic. Body is oily with soft carbonation. Finish is long and balanced bitter and sweet with notes of passion fruit, pomelo, caramel, toffee, orange, mandarin, cream, raspberry yogurt and hints of spices. Smooth and nicely balanced.
From cervezasespeciales. In teku glass. Watching Sons of Anarchy 2x08. Very tasty, refreshing and nice smelling. It left my wanting more

Shared bottle. Pours is cloudy amber with big white head, leaves some lacing. Aroma of malts, caramel, biscuits, orange peel, fruity and floral. Taste is medium bitter, hints of sweetnes, caramel mouthfeel. Medium to heavy body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. More a red ale than a witbier, good one.

I like the beer a lot, but I wouldnt consider it a winter warmer due to the lightness in color and heavy hops. the white is too light and the red ale is just hoppy. The beer is really tasty, but not to style. Opaque red with a nice dry finish. Tap

A hazy amber body with a scarce white head that leaves lacing on the glass. Nose has notes of lemon peels, caramel and white pepper. Taste is quite sweet with a mildly bitter finish. Medium carbonation and fairly rich palate. This is a bit too sweet for my palate but the aroma is nice and refreshing.

Bottle from the Mikkeller Christmas Calendar. Hazy amber with small offwhite head. Hoppy, caramely aroma, peach and apricot. Sweetish citrus flavour, light spice and yeast, hazelnuts, more caramel and alcohol. Hoppy bitterness.

Beautiful amber brown with perfect creamy head. Really complex aroma, the banana amb bread from the wheat is noticeable, but so is the bread and caramel from the roasted malt. Also theres some herbs and grass hidden in there too. Taste is medium bitter with some light sweetness, both distinguishable. Its waaay too fizzy for me and it has a strong bitter finish. Overall a nice blend of two styles, though the witbier part of it is present in aroma, but not too much in taste.

On 33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Grünerløkka. Hazy deep golden color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity; hoppy, malt, lightly roasted , and citrus. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
1/3 pint @ BrewDog Helsinki. Sameahko, kauniin meripihkan ruskea. Tuoksussa tuhdin makeaa mallasta, miellyttävää humalaa, hiukan karamellia. Maussa humalaa, mallasta.

Pours deep amber with yellow head. Sweet spicy aroma. Malt, yeast, calamel, bread crumb, orange peel. Smooth, well balanced. Medium bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber body with a large creamy off-white head. Nose is red berries, nuts, coriander, soapy herbs, straw, honey and hints of nougat and red fruits. Taste is melon, red fruits, coriander, bitter herbs, grapefruit and hints of nougat, nuts, alcohol and straw. Medium body, medium to high carbonation. Pretty nice wit/red ale hybrid; the red ale dominates but there is still a bit of a wit in there behind all the strong hoppy amber flavors. But the category here should be American Strong Ale, because this is certainly not "just another wit"...

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Lillemarkens. Pours murky orange to copper. Some white head. Fruit and pine nose. Very thick, oily body.. Medium amount of carbonation. Sweet, almost cloying. Quite bitter ending. Tropical fruit, pineapple, pine, honey, some caramel and malt flavour. Seems very fresh. Good!

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen.Gulgråbrun. Uklar. Høyt luftig skum med pene filigranser. Behagelig, litt lett appelsinaroma. Smaken en god del appelsin med et snev av krydder. Svakt syrlig ettersmak.

Tap at Fairbar. Hazy deep red body with a white head. Fruity and malty aroma with a bit of caramel sweetness. Sweet, moderately malty taste with heavy bitterness. Hoppy and spicy flavours. Medium body with average carbonation. Fruity and bitter finish. Very tasty witbier, and perfect for the season.
How : bottle Appearance : hazy dark red, medium white head. Aroma : grass, ripe fruits, pine, citrus peel, herbs, caramel in the back. Palate : medium body, soft carbonation.

Sweet fruity and malty, wheaty, some nice spices going on, orange peel, some nice spicey notes here, lovely.

---Sent via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Grosse mousse. Cest un peu de tout cette bière et presque nimporte quoi. Cest très aqueux en particulier. Mais ça reste intéressant. Malgré tout donc, mais un rien troublant ... Jolie étiquette en tout cas
330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere.fr. Pours hazy amber with off-white head. Aroma is spicy, herbal and sweet. Taste is thick and juicy with interesting spice and ripe resinous fruit. Sumptuous.

orange, cloudy appearance frothy, white head
citrus, herbs aroma
clinical taste, absolutely nothing for me
light body, thin feel, lively carbonation

Cloudy carroty / dark orange / brownish color, huge tan head. Hoppy and yeasty aroma, lots and lots of fruit, just wonderful. Orange, peach, some pine and biscuit. Medium to heavy bitterness and medium sweetness. Full body, average carbonation. Not a classic wit, extremely pleasant. (Svijet Piva 1,5l bottle)

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2016 Cloudy amber color, huge off white head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity, piney, peachy. Taste of citrus, tropical fruits, malt, orange. Full body soft carbonation. Surprisingly bitter and complex. Dry finish. Awesome wit.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle, 06/01/15. Muddied peach with a low clumping skim of head. Exotic, heavily perfumed aroma with suggestions of caraway, Haribo, jasmine and grenadine syrup. Mouth slightly agape with Californian peach and the ripe dragon fruit of hop Belgianed to the nines with mysterious seeds, dried flowers and flicked patchouli ash. Stamped indelibly with Belgium. Mad and soupy. Aggressive with spice like Belgian beer tasted when first I tasted it. Hops and spices aromatically cocktailed. Mad for the no alcohol beers of late but I do miss sinking a big spicy Belgian and talking bollocks at the internet.

330ml bottle. Hazy amber colour with average to huge, frothy, fully lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Intense, resinous hoppy aroma, citrusy notes of grapefruit and orange. Taste is bitter hoppy, lots of grapefruit, some blood orange, orange zest, a sweaty resinous touch, moderately sweet caramel malty basis. I guess Id rubricated it under IIPA in a blind tasting.
Bottle 1,5l. Cloudy orange/brown liquid with big yellowish head. Heavy body, light carbonation. Veggies, spice, fruits. Very good.

Pours a murky golden yellow with a frothy white head which remains. Aroma is hop resin, citrus orange, slight spices, slight coriander and a hint of pepper. Taste is coriander, spices, pepper and citrus which leads to a medium bitter finish. Full bodied with a slick mouthfeel.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours clear amber, nose is dark fruit, pine, caramel, taste is similar, rich and fruity.

Bottle @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Aroma is quite hoppy, with tropical and citrusy notes. Taste is quite sweet, quite bitter, and little sour. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, surprisingly sweet finish.

When witbier and IPA meet. Great floral and citrus aroma. Nice light golden color. Full mouthfeel with good carbonation as this bottle had some age on it. Fantastic flavor with hops bitterness up front balanced by wheat and spices to make for a wonderful holiday treat.
Bottle @ The Bishops Arms Marina Plaza, Helsingborg 3/1-15. Fruity, yeasty, spicy. Body is medium, the finish is dry.

On tap at Nakameguro taproom 2014/12/23. Served in a snifter. Pinkish Amber color with nice white head. Lots of haze in the glass.Pine and resin aroma strong with cinnamon and citrus. Very hop-forward on the palate. Grassy dry finish. Bit of tartness as well.

Aroma of malt, caramel, sweet fruits, pine, yeasty notes, hint of herbs, fresh hops. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a long medium bitter finish. Wonderfully balanced. Has little to do with Witbier, but who cares? Because its a damn tasty beer.

On tap at Mikkeller Bangkok 1 year anniversary party.
Thin creamy white head. Cloudy amber pour. Nice bitterness. Well hidden alcohol.

W aromacie słodko, karmelowo, kandyzowane owoce, cytrusy. Połączenie DIPA i Barley Wine. W smaku także dość słodko, z goryczką średnią, alkoholową, charaktaerystyczną dla belgijskich tripli itp. Bardzo dobre!

big bottle 1500ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Why to chear New Year 2015 with champagne when this is in the house;))). Orange/amber coloured, huge off-white head, lively carbonation, yeasty spicy nose. Malty, spicy, yeasty and fruity with touch of grapefruit and oranges. Mild grassy and spicy finish. Not the best from the style but good enough.
Bottle at home on Christmas Eve. Yeah so I had another one instead of peeling potatoes, trimming sprouts and making Christmas butter. Overall a good beer. Citrus, straw, sour-ish taste. Warming. Yum.
Bottle @ The Bishops Arms Marina Plaza, Helsingborg 150103. Wheaty and fruity, spicy and light yeasty, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter, wheaty and fruity.

Draft at bistro on bridge. Pours hazy yellow with a large white head. The aroma is lemon and floral. The taste is dry, light bitter, not awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle split two ways. Reddish pour with a frothy head. Quite hoppy with peaches, orange peel, some citrus and vanilla sweetness. Finish is light bitter. More of a amber ale than anything else.

Tasted from a magnum bottle on New Years Eve, thanks Stefan. Hazy orange beer with copper hue under a sticky, stable, pale beige head. Perfumey aroma of candied orange, fresh apricot, pipe tobacco, pink grapefruit, pumpkin soup, sundried tomatoes, honey, bell peppers, apple sauce, brown bread, Grand Marnier, ginger and brown rhum. Fresh citrusy and very fruity onset, sweetish with a strong candied orange impression, marmelade, tomato accent, some sourish wheat, yeasty, smooth caramelly malt sweetness, complex spicy notes, long peppery and citrusy hop bitterness in the finish along with malt sweetness and some warming alcohol. Interesting beer which has survived the years of cellaring exceptionally well, but I fail to see the link with either a witbier or an Irish red; if I had to taste this blind, my guess in terms of style would be an American strong ale.

Really nice balance to this Christmas hybrid style, one of the better I had this year, especially so on tap if you can get it (thank god for Mikkeller Bar SF!)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

3oz sample at Expo Cerveza Mexico 2014. An opaque amber beer with a small white head that fades away after a minute. Aroma is of grapefruit, alcohol and sweet spices. Taste is bitter with a very strong mint finish. Almost no carbonation and a lot of astringency. Strong aftertaste. Maybe too strong?

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Stas & Vova. Pours 
brown with a beige head, aroma of caramel, marmalade, hops, flavor is bitter with lemon, tangerine, grapefruit, medium bodied.

Huge head. Intense piney yeast banana spicy clove? Dry bitter rules the mouthfeel fueled up. Crazy hybrid brew for a crazy Night.

Bottle sampled at Essen Winterbeer Festival 2014. Pours clear light golden brown with an off white head. Aroma of malt, citrus and urinal cake. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Hop herbal fruit spice aroma. Clear red Amber colour great head and lacing. Malt fruit herbal spice flavour. Smooth palate. Mikkeller bar Bangkok.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Hazy, copper colour. Minimal, white head. Orangey, gingery hop. Some ripe peach in there. Very fruity. Orange peel. Theres some wit character, but this feels IPA territory, more than anything. Taste is fruity bitter. Light sweet. Light dry. Feels under 8%. Finishes fresh, hoppy bitter.

33cl bottle at home. Hazy amber brown with a medium off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Quite some bitterness with some sweet fruity tones. Pine, grapefruit, citrus, caramel, spices and herbs. A nice bitter brew.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Stas & Vova. Cloudy orange-amber with an off-white head. Soapy aroma with stale hops and a bit of spiciness. Sweetish flavor with malt, soapy yeasty spiciness, stlae hops and some bitterness and alcohol. Medium-bodied. Not my thing.

Teku glass. Golden/reddish colour with dense, medium head. Average lacing. Malty (caramel) aroma, with spices and hops in the background. Medium bitterness, light to medium spicy aromas (mainly orange peel). From the middle taste is dominated by hops. Dry, semi thick texture, above average carbonation, Finish is long, dry and hoppy.

Bottle at Kerstbierfest 2014. Clear gold pour with white head. Aroma of peppery and leafy hop, light sprucy notes, nice honey. Taste is sweet with leafy hop bitterness, light fruitiness, relatively light (compared to the other beers today probably) Belgian IPA style, not bad.

Orange color with a hint of amber and a medium head. Aroma is caramely, but also spicy and hoppy. Taste is spicy and bitter, the orange peel is also there. Good finish and nice carbonation. Juicy mouthfeel. A very good one!

Sampled @ O.B.E.R. Kerstbierfestival 2014, Essen.

Trübes orangebraunes Bier mit geringer beiger Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, malzig, tropische Früchte, leicht hefig. Geschmack sehr fruchtig malzig, hopfig, reife Früchte, lecker!

In short: sticky bittersweet resin beer.
Aroma: hops and grass.
Appearance: pours ambarine brown, with white crown.
Taste: light sweet and medium bitter.
Palate: sticky and kind of thick, lasting bitter finish.

A delicious head scratcher. Pours a beautiful cloudy orange amber pink. Persistent thin white head. Tastes of tart berry, orange, super dry hoppy finish. Accent on the hops. The witbier aspects just add depth and spicy complexity. Not sure what to make it, but its delightful.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 33cl Bottle @Cimmeria. Oviedo 05/12/2014
Oviedo,05/12/2014 Botella de @Vivalabirra, Oviedo 26/02/17
Color ambar, especiado, dilce
Poured a slightly hazy orange amber with a frothy tan head. Aroma of moderately heavy citrus and caramel malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, medium bitter.

I met this beer at Mikkeller × Brewdog event in 2014.11.29 in Tokyo and it becomes one of my favorite beer although I don't prefer Bergian style. That's why it is high alchohol brended white & red ale made by distinctive of Mikkeller. Awesome!

Tap @ Mikkeller bar DK. Verschil tussen smaak en aroma is behoorlijk. Aroma is subtiel, misschien iets te op de achtergrond, alsof je langs een fruitwinkel loopt, de zweem die in de neus blijft hangen. Smaak is citrus maar ook diepe fruit smaken als aardbei en perzik. De bitterheid blijft flink hangen. Alles zo perfect in balans. Oranje en troebel, weinig kraag.

Cervesa que tot i tenir 8% dalcohol es nota molt lleugera, és bastant dolça i afruitada.
Cerveza que aunque tiene 8% de alcohol se nota muy ligera, es bastante dulce y frutada.
33 cl bottle 8.0% abv. deep honey golden colour.dry and bitter and very spicy. oily mouthfeel. good!

On tap BrewDog Manchester. Pours opaque light brown with a medium-sized head that leaves lacing. The aroma displays ripe fruitiness, caramel, syrup and berries. Taste is sweet initially, light bitter in finish. It features caramel, ripe fruits and spicy notes. The palate is medium to full bodied, the texture a bit sticky. Not at all a witbier, more like a scotch ale in my book. Works fine though, especially as a Christmas ale.

Brewers Droop, Bristol
330ml Bottle (BBE: 27/08/17)
Blood Alc: 0mg/100ml

Syrupy, berry / strawberry wheat aroma with spicy yeast characteristics. Big strong yellowish head which holds itself together pretty solidly even when I blew a bit out over the edge of the glass. The head itself is really bitter, really hoppy, of spice and fruit, tastes a bit like hops being boiled.Flavour is bitter with berry fruit sweetness and a big grain body. text: Bottle, an interesting combination of styles, definitely a bit of Wit beer lurking in the background, although dominated by the american hops, making it a sort of bitter american pale ale, nice brew but not worth the price tag!

A total joke to call this a belgian white. Once again mikkeller makes a beer style into an ipa and not one of the best. Red amber with pale brown head. Aromacitrus and pine. Taste just overwhelmingly bitter.

Bottle at Cherry Reds, Birmingham. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, red berry fruit. The flavour is moderate bitter with a woody earthy mineral hop bitter palate and a bubbly mouthfeel. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

The aroma is very fruity and fresh/citrus-like. The taste is very fresh as well. Very golden and orange in appearance.Details of cascade hops are present. Botella de 33 cl en el lupulo en el momento el 14-11-2014. color oscuro con espuma beige. Sabores especiados, maltosos y algo dulces con un final amargo ligero. Cuerpo medio fácil de beber. No esta mal.

13.11.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet grassy, leafs, wet grass, yeast, orange peel, wheat, spices, minerals, dried fruits. Taste is harsh grassy, old leafs, harsh grass, minerals, hops, soap, alcohol, cardboard, wet grain, plastics. Longlasting bitterness, dry harsh mouthfeel. Meh!

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a little sediment and a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus, orange peel, candy sugar, and pine - with a slightly bitter finish.

330ml bottle from Cimmeria, Oviedo. 13-11-2014.
BBD: 27-08-2017.
In short: nice witbier?
Pours hazy ambe with nice creamy off white head. Long head retention, some lacing.Caramel, honey, citrusy, malty and spicy aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is smooth, some sweet fruity notes, moderate bitterness, some dry aftertaste. Still looking for wheat character.
Tap. Dov arom av sötma , alkoholen märks av i smaken. Beska alkoholeftersmak.
Fat på mikkeller and friends - djupt bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Full maltig kropp med en tydlig fast ändå behaglig beska.

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop.
Amber, hazy body, with a big, frothy to creamy, light beige head.
Aroma of wheat, berries, tropical fruits, orange, some banana, caramel.
Taste is about the same, also spices and more orange peel.
Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a medium carbonation and it finishes spicy, wheaty, medium bitter, fruity and a bit astringent.

Tasty! One of the best Wit beers Ive ever had, although it is pretty unique for this style and also has a bit with an IPA or Amber Ale in common. Great balance, lovely, manifold wheat and fruit notes and easy to drink despite the high ABV.

0,33 ml Bottle. Dla mnie to piwo dziwne nieco, przekombinowane. Belgian wit sie nie czuje. Zero pszenicznych nut. Wiecej jest tu Red Ale. Srednia piana ale kremowa i dosc trwala, mocno metne i bursztynowe piwo, nie do konca czerwone. Pszyprawy sa wyczuwalne sa one nieco rozgrzewajace. Amerykanske chmiele w pokaznej ilosci i zdominowaly wszystko. Slodowosc jest obecna ale nie moze sie pszebic przez chmielowa dominacje.

1,5L bottle, BB 15.08.2021. Pours amber with light tan head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, caramel, Amarillo hops, fruits. Flavor is sweet, fruits, caramel, citrus, bitter orange. Finish is fruity bitter. Overall: more dipa than, witbier, but I like it.

Shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Orange beer, big frothy white head. Nose is lots of citrus, malt, hops, caramel. Flavor is citric notes, caramel, fruity hops, decent amount of spice. More citrus in the pretty hoppy and bitter finish. Not bad at all, heavy yet drinkable.

"Starts off with a surprising amount of citrusy hops, and this may not even have been a new/fresh bottle. Light spices, clove, yeast, and hops in equal measure. Not a great beer, but very quaffable, and shows NO sign of the abv. Glad I found a deal, though."

3oz sample at Expo Cerveza Mexico 2014. Murky dark amber. Sweet grainy aroma with hints of toffee, caramel, spices, dried fruits and alcohol. Robust with moderate carbonation. Strong bitter character with a heavy alcohol feel. Heavy, warming and complex.

This was poured into a mug and shared with my buddy Darin.
The appearance was a semi - hazy burnt orange to slight ruddy brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute. The lacing was somewhat there but slid for the most part. 
The smell had a nice blend of sweet citrus to mandarin orange with a decent caramel base in the background. Lightly spiced through some coriander. 
The taste was mainly sweet but allowed a decent spice in the background. 
On the palate, there was a decent amount of spice to allow some carbonation to hit the tongue just right. It sat about a medium on the body and I found myself sipping this for the most part. 
Overall, well Darin paid for it and he said it was $33 for one bottle. Holy crap, so not worth it. This one is good but not worth the price.

Keg at BD. Very muddy dark orange. Nice creamy head. Nose is tart fruit, some playful yeasty vibes. Taste and palate excellent. Tight bubble structure marries well with dry, tart and bitter peel, little mineral, sweet vinous notes. Some caramel too. Dry finish with hop burn. Just great and stylistically between the cracks.

Keg at Brewdog. Orange, pretty clear, big white head. Aroma - bubblegum, cucumber, slightly sour, caramel, estery. Interesting. Body is medium, no real carbonation, quite foamy and rich. Taste is lemon, wheat, straw, slightly sour. Good.

Keg at Brewdog Shepard?s bush at the weird beard launch. Aroma is spicy tangy, tart funky orange with a touch of caramel malts. Touch of sour on the nose as well. Translucent orange red coloured pour with a big lasting white head. Flavour is funky fermenting orange, touch of sour, touch of caramel malts and wheats. Palate is fairly full and smooth. Moderate carbonation. Some alcohol presence.

Draught at BrewDog Shepherds Bush. Pours cloudy orange, with a dense white head and great lacing. Aroma of blood orange, floral hops and cloves. Sharp citrus hop flavours, mixing well with bready malt and soft fruit. Finish is mellow citrus fruit, mandarin and wheat.
Tap at Brewdog Shepherds Bush, cloudy amber with a bright and fresh citrus and plum-tart nose, fruity, dry-sweet, horse blankets, rich and boozy.

Aroma - hopps and vanilla. Very ballanced beer, with a bit of tangerine or orange peel. Not too pushy, I like the bitterness of the hops. Its complicated how this beer can be sweet and bitter in the same time.
Keg at BrewDog Shepherds Bush, London. A dark orange/straw coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, fruity, spice aroma. Tastes vaguely hoppy, orange, spice, slightly yeasty.

At kerst bier festival
Copper, white foam. Some flowery citric yeasty notes in the aroma. Carbonated a lot, light mouthfeel. Again malty and then hoppy. But not incredible

Magnum bottle: bright copper pour with fluffy white head. Aroma is strong if citrus with hints of honey, malt and spice. Pretty clean. I would never guess this was a Belgian style beer. Orange, malt/honey with spice and bitterness. Long finish. Very drinkable. Not what I expected but I like it a lot. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep orange and light copper coloured body with a rich, four centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of spruce, bright hops, alcohol, tons of bread, yeast and a little earthy malt. Medium-bodied; Super pungent earthy malt flavours up front with a deep caremlised sugar flavour and some spice, spruce and herbal note right behind. Aftertaste is quite deep and showing a lot of bread and yeast, but the spice and sugars last long. Overall, a nice spiced beer, but this isnt a witbier and Im not exactly sure what a red ale is - so im not sure what category this belongs in, but definitely not wit. Good to try, but as with most Mik beers - way overrated and almost purely a marketing bit. I sampled this magnum bottle (1,5L) purchased and shared by Kevin on my hockey team on 06-February-2014 - Thanks Kev!
Aroma of Belgium style ale, maybe of the yeast culture used. Fresh, flowery, fruity, hoppy. Quite sweet enjoyable beer which I would enjoy in the evening while watching some movie.

50.7 oz. magnum from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA. Dark orange pour with a tall, foamy off-white head. Aroma of mango, orange peel, and freshly cut grass. The taste is a marriage of bitterness from grapefruit and tangerine hops, pine, grass, and Belgian yeast. Alcohol is well hidden. This is a great beer but I would not classify this as a witbier.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 Ouch. .so many things going on here. Would like to taste in proper glassware under proper condition. First thing you say about this brew.. Belgian! With great impact of hops balanced with pleasant maltiness, caramel. NoticeableBelgian yeast, wheat, pine and spices, mostly coriander.
Huge, complex, thou highly drinkable brew. Love it! Great mix


after 6 months.. time is not best friend of this brew..  theres only solid malt background with nice hop kick. Rather simple, nothing fancy
Un hybride sapiné et collant avec un nez de vin dorge et des notes mentholées déstabilisantes. Rondeur exceptionnelle et buvabilité majestueuse.
A fruity vanilla aroma and a mixture of malts and hop flavors. Lots of bubbles with a full palate. Long hop finish.
Keg at Brewdog. Pours clear dark orange, small white head. Booze and orange aromas. Christmassy for sure! Tasty bitter orange, and hop bite. Good.

1.5L bottle on Christmas Day, 2012 vintage. Poured a slightly hazy ruby color with a medium sized white head. Aroma was notes of citrus, pine resin. Flavor had some light spicy notes, some earthy malts and plenty of light sweet raisin notes, touch of orange zest. Warming.

Aged 2 years (2011 vintage). Slightly hazy copper with a thin white head. Nose is herbal and bright fruity, like cherries covered in juicy NZ hops with a bit of Christmas spice. Flavor is herbal and champagne like with dry esters and a earthy hop note thats a bit like pine and a bit like mistletoe. Cheerful and sippable.

Pours cloudy dark orange. Large frothy rocky creamy off-white head lasted through the last sip. Aroma is hoppy fruity and plenty of spices. Especially orange peel and coriander. Flavor much the same. Sweet and bitter. Spices. Wheat. Alcohol present but not in the way. Tasty and drinkable.

Aroma: Caramel, lots of hops, grape. Taste: exactly the same as in aroma. You are drinking what you are smelling :) I found my new favorite beer- which I would love to have 50 bottles at home. Awesome balance of taste, smell, aftertaste, appearance. If you pour this beer quickly in the glass,white thick foam seems is going to remain forever.

Frugtig, wit duft med en undelægning af meget let karamel.
Mørk gylden og uklar i bunden.
Meget humlet og imødekommende bitterhed. Fyldig og hvedet. Rund og kun let sød. Frugtig kompleks.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 ver.
Smells like sticky pot. Changes to orange peals as it warms up.
Thick and malty- med bodied. Not as complex as 2012 ver. Good and easy to drink.
Big bottle. Hops, orange, light caramel on the nose. A little effervescent, long finish. Spices on the palate: clove, coriander, white pepper, pine. Lots of fruit on the finish, and not too sweet.

1.5L Bottle at Aunt Robins for the holidays. Pour is murky amber orange with a big tan head and great lacing. Fruity, tangy, somewhat bready, citrusy, orange peel, doughy, and vanilla in the aroma. Taste is grassy, lightly tart, earthy, orange, goopy, bready, and sweet vanilla. Medium body with soft carbonation. OK, but really nothing special.
On tap at beer revolution. Hazy blood orange. Aroma of raspberry and cheese. Taste is tart/bitter. Lasting dry finish.
Draught at Bishop Arms, Copenhagen. Hazy reddish orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of oranges, spice, caramel, yeast and sour notes.
Draught at The Beer Trappe. Malty and slightly sticky. Hops present. Orange body. Some fruit in finish. Decent.

20 dec 2013, tap. Light gold, clear, no bubbles. Nose is pot and lemon juice. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Sugary sweet lemon juice. Really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Craft Beer Market. Pours a merky copper with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malts, tropical fruits, caramelish wheat, Belgian yeast, and light spice(coriander I think). Flavour is spicy Belgian yeast, citrus, orange, grapefruit, resin, mild sweetness, and medium bitterness.

Dougy citrus smells with a slight hop under it. Glowing deep peach color. Thick tart wheat bitter but brought back with citrus and pine. Light coating but refreshed palate for how thick the beer is. Delicious.

Small glass from tap at The Bishop Arms in Copenhagen where it was nicely served at the very right drinking temperature. Remaining patchy surface to a red-orange coloured body, cloudy. Red oranges on the nose. Citrus fruity taste carefully added by Christmas spices like cinnamon. Caramel and wheat beneath. Lingering finish of citrus shells. Full bodied. Very much to my liking. (Copenhagen 09.12.2013).

light yellow head disappears quickly with some lacing. amber colour. aroma boozy, coriander, citrus, spruce and hops. taste like aroma with walnut peel, slight sour with long bitter finish. medium body and carbonation. nice.  bottle 75 cl @ kerstbierfest 2013

Bottle, 2011 vintage. Pours almost clear amber with pinkish red hue. Aroma of dried fruit, sherry, resinous pine, caramel. Taste of sherry fruits, raisins, plum, orange and pine, biscuit, toffee. Quite crisp. Very tasty and nothing like a witbier, possibly due to age or possibly because it was never really like one to begin with

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 Alla spina. Nebuloso color aranciato con un soffice velo di schiuma biancastra. Sentori di luppolo, albicocche sciroppate, toffee e arancia rossa; gusto dolciastro, luppolato, fruttato e leggermente speziato con un retrogusto amarognolo con note di cannella e scorze di agrumi. Corpo medio, effervescenza gentile, struttura setosa. Ricorda tutto tranne che una witbier, ma indipendentemente dallo stile resta eccezionale!

Smells nice , sweet , hop 
Taste is bit bitter , sugary , sweet. 
Aftertaste is hoppy , bitterness

On draught at 2013 Holiday Beer Summit at Roscoes. Fizzy dark amber color. Aroma is orange peel, nutmeg, coriander, and citrus hops. Taste is like a spiced mulled wine but with a citrus hoppiness and light malt profile, but with a much better mouthfeel and balance. Great hybrid.

Bottle @ unibaren. Slightly clouded orange, medium white head that settles nicely, good lacing. Aroma, malty, hoppy, piney, grapefruit, citrus, fruity, mango, alcohol, wheat. Taste, malty, hoppy, fruity, mango, fruity, wheat, tangerine. Dry bitter fruity aftertaste.
Very well balanced beer, interesting, kind of a hybrid. Enjoyable hoppiness.

Draught. Low fluffy and quickly disappearing off-white head. Hazy orange body. Sweeet citrussy spicy aroma and flavor with a heavy shot of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long bitter finish. Alcohol well hidden. When I look of the former ratings I wonder a bit and think it is far too overrated. The Mikkeller brand is hyped, could that be the reason?

1500ml Bottle. The pour was a clear copper brown with a huge (3-4 fingers) cream colored fluffy head that had great retention and lasted throughout, reducing finally to a large cap with excellent sticky runny lacing.

The aroma was of a biscuit malt, pine hops and a sweaty yeast with notes of caramel, citrus (grapefruit and orange peel), corriander and a touch of clove.

The taste was a bitter malty with a mild caramel sweetness and a hint of citrus from the beginning, the finish on the other hand became rather hoppy with a slight citrus peel bitterness and a bit of spice towards the end. The flavor lasted a good long duration following the swallow, with a bitter hoppy and a spicy sweet taste left behind to linger on the taste buds.

Mouthfeel was a step or two past light in body with a mildly dry texture and a medium carbonation.

Overall this was an interesting brew for sure. Even though I really did not get much of the Witbier yeast flavor coming through, I did notice the slightly spicy citrusy flavor. But the Red Ale in this hybrid most definitely is the most dominant of the two...
Tap at Lizardville, RR almost too much going on in this beer, with the orange and hop fighting for who is dominant, lack of coriander and full body that I expect from a wit

(Magnum thanks to mar) pours an opaque copper-ruby with soapy tan bubbles that dont stick around too long. Nose of pine, honey, richness, citrus and caramel. Taste is more bitter than I expected for the age and from the nose, pine, citrus peel, honey, rich caramel, and a linger thats a bit estery but also sweet. Medium thick body, thats oily and delicious.

75 cL bottle from Beers of Europe into a pint glass at home.  Plentiful bubbly head over a fizzy, opaque red/orange beer.  Lovely hopped citrus orange aroma.  Dry, and bitter, and a little spiced.  Pretty good.  Just a hint of alcohol potency.
There are plenty of bottles left at the Canals in Delran NJ.   Huge botte. A good brew with hop, pine, caramel malts some spice and earth. Mikkeller always delivers and this brew was no different.

29th December 2009ChrisO Night Of The Gaylords tasting. Rich hoppy nose with a touch of cranberry. Softish palate. Light fruity hops with some marmalade. Orange and red (cranberry) hop fruits. Delicious!

Bottle thanks to FletchFighters. Pours a light golden orange with billowy white head. Aromas of floral fruity hops. Flavours show lots of wheat and a decent resiny bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel. Good stuff.
A little late for Cristmas but was on tap at Roasthouse,  reddish amber with noce head and fragrance  quite malty for a saison with nice level of spice

Rated this last night on paper. Giant bottle (1 qt. 1 pt. 2.7 oz, to be exact) found on the discount shelf at Enoteca in PF, ID shared with Brenn79. Aroma is way hoppy. I get spruce needles (maybe?), lemon, coriander. Pours cloudy orange with a giant long-lasting off-white pillowy head. Creamy lace sheets the glass. Taste starts out sweet and spicy and finishes wit a bitter hop bite. Definitely more red ale or IPAish than witbier. Crisp, interesting, tasty. Carbonation is average and the mouthfeel is creamy. I was really impressed with this at first, but it started to get a little old. That was a really big bottle.

1 qt. 1 pt. 2.7 oz btl- Pours a very hazy orange with a dense off white head, very nice looking beer. The aroma is hoppy, very spicy, Christmas spices, mint and cinnamon, coriander. Taste is very wheaty, Christmas spices, alcohol is very noticeable. Body is medium, carbonation is also medium. Overall I really liked it, I do wish that alcoholic bite would subside though.

Long Island, NY - Magnum bottle that survived the holiday season. It poured a hazy burnt orange color with lots of fluffy white head. Aroma was highly floral and hoppy, odd for a Witbier. Taste is where I got confused, no witbier at all. All that I got were hops and bitterness. Don't get me wrong this is an awesome brew a hybrid IPA.

Draught pours reddish brown with whitish head.  Aromas are tropical fruit like pineapple and mango with some earthiness.  Taste is fruity, earthy, and a nice bitter hop bite.  Overall, a nicely done beer.  Would gladly have it again.
I knew this would be Kevin Scotts favorite beer. Before it was ever made...

Orange/yellow with a small off-white head. Aroma is huge on the pine needles/grass with oranges, peaches, and sweet syrup in the background. Flavor is a lot like the aroma but with belgian spices/yeast added. A lot hoppy than I would have expected as well.

Draft.  Small off-white head, hazy amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, orange/grapefruit, some caramel, pine.  Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit/orange, some pine, caramel.  Medium body, some resin.

THOUGHTS: Nice, but not Christmasy. Nice hybrid. Actually very nice. It kept getting better as it warmed. Orange, caramel and spice were the main aromas and flavors.
TECHNICAL: Magnum bottle. Poured a cloudy, light to medium amber with a large, creamy, off-white head that mostly, but slowly, diminished and that left excellent lacing. The aroma had moderate caramel and wheat; moderate to heavy pine, grapefruit and orange hops; light to moderate doughy, spicy and dusty yeast; orange; and coriander. The initial flavor was light to mod sweet, mod to heavily acidic and moderately bitter; while the finish was moderately sweet, mod to heavily acidic and heavily bitter with a long duration. There was caramel malt, wheat, lots of citrus, orange, coriander, pepper, grapefruit; some other fruitiness, spicy yeast and hops, and some metallic hops. The medium to full body was creamy, then dry with fizzy carbonation and a metallic and moderately astringent finish.

2010 bottle at Camp Beer IX. Pours a clear orange copper with smalll off white head.  Hoppy floral and yeast aroma. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet malt with honey flavor. Hides the alcohol well, a very good Belgian wit from Mikkelller.
Massive Mikkeller pt.2 This is what I imagine a Christmas beer tasting like. Pretty much spot on christmas tree. Piney and earthy with hints of spice. Definitely different but pretty good.

1500ml bottle.  Red White Christmas on Christmas day 2011- beer number 1500 , doesnt get much better than this. A big thick beige coloured head head greets you and the beer itself is a bold deep amber, almost orange colour. Pine needles and orange peel dominate the aroma which is very pleasing. The flavour is very strong and stays in the mouth for a long time. Body is strong and leads into a very smooth and silk like texture. Aftertaste is piney. It took a few hours to work my way through this one but it was a few hours well spent.

This is the 2010 vintage drank with a year of age on it. 

The beer pours an orange color with a white head. The aroma has some wheat and earthy notes, but there is also a leathery quality that reminds me of beers that have brett in it. Since I dont think brett is in the beer, I am not sure what is going on. 

The flavor also has a leathery component to it. I also get a lot of Belgian yeast and earth notes, as well as some orange citrus. The alcohol is fairly well hidden.

Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. 

Not sure brett is accidentally in the beer or if something else is going on that leads me to get the brett qualities. Regardless, the beer was pretty good.
En tirador color dorado oscuro, buena espuma y retencion.aromas a especias , clavo, lupulo y levadura belga.sabor intenso con cuerpo, final amargo agradable.

Pour out of bottle is hazy orange with slightly off white head, aroma has orange, pine, toffee, some caramel and biscuit notes, but a really hoppy aroma.  Taste is also fairly hoppy with some big fruity flavors as well, orange mainly with pine and sprucy notes, touch of caramel and biscuit, finishes fairly bitter.
Si no ho saps, no tho creus que aquesta cervesa porti una part de blat. Bona textura, carbonatació y amargor. Gran cervesa.
Bottled, cloudy golden orange grapefruit color, rocky frothy head, hoppy pien crisp aroma, flavor is hoppy , bright clean malt, lasting finish

Deep amber colored pour. Huge off-white head that sticks around for a bit, a long bit. Plenty of lacing. Big hoppy aroma with hints of pepper and malt. A little bit of a fruity/banana aroma. Hoppy flavor with a spicy backbone. Sweet and dry, a little on the thin side. But overall pretty decent.

On tap in a snifter.  Pours amber with a lacy head.  Aroma of caramel malts, some wheat and light fruits, a little spiciness, plus a lot of hops.  Flavor the same.  Strong on hops, not like most of this style.  Smooth texture.  A pretty good beer.

Aroma of substantial citrus and spruce with some caramel and coriander. Appearance was red with white head. Flavor has hops up front with some sugar, the malt is muted by the citrus finish. Palate is bubbly. Alright.

Bottle. Pours an amber like color with a white head. Aroma is nice and hoppy with lots of sweet citrus fruits like orange, tangerine and mandarin, some spice like coriander and clove, light breadiness and sweet malt. The flavor follows the nose some spice like clove and coriander sweet citrus fruit hop flavors like orange, tangerine and mandarins along with the sweet malt and light breadiness. The body is medium with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a really nice blend of styles reminiscent of Amber Ale/IPA and Witbier.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2012 1.5L bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Olutopas Pikkujoulu 2011) - shared by someone generous - thanks! (6:3:7:4:13=3.3)
6 Super sweet mandarin peach and toffee aroma.
3 Sludgy, but we were at the bottom of the bottle, after many pours.

From the top of the bottle this time - and its a lovely clear red. Apart from that difference, its mostly the same as before. Things related to teh slidginess are gone, and the toffee aspects too - this is drier. A real zingy bitter bite, but also smooth. Tasty - I like it, but it might be a little bit too agressive in places.

sampled 75 cl. bottle @ Kerstbierfestival 2011: A: deep hazy orange with seizable fluffy white head  S: delicious sweet american hops & touch on the sweeter side spices  T: Belgian yeast, oranges & citrus, fruity, touch of spices & hint malt, very hoppy, sweetness in the back, even touch rijsttaart in the finish, balanced, sweet & hoppy  B: dry & fizzy  delicious but more of an IIPA than a wit

Magnum from Asahiya. Cloudy reddish brown, nice head. Nice nose, hoppy, with wheat, some caramel, fruit. Very full bodied and warming. Sweet, but balanced well with hops. Nice bitter finish. Excellent.

Deep, clear, amber-orange with a big fluffy cream colored head. Lacing is pretty thick. Aroma of citrus, caramel, slight raisin and spice. Taste is sweet fruit, yeast and malt with a substantial finishing bitterness. Medium bodied, pretty full actually for the style, with lively, fizzy carbonation and dry. Nice rendition of a witbier, a lot hoppier than most, and for the most part, not even resembling the typical wit. It seems like more of an IPA with Belgian yeast. Merry Christmas to me.

Keg at Craft. Cloudy amber orange colour with small bubbly white head. Aroma is a touch spicy and quite malty. Bit of ginger too, and a bit cakey. Fruity too. Taste not as exciting as the smell, but nice and smooth, malty and a bit spicy. Bit of bitterness, especially in the finish. Fruit in there too. Towards the end it gets a bit boozy, but still lots of spicy fruit. Very nice.

Sampled at OBER Kerstbierfestival Essen 2011. Cloudy hazy opaque dark orange color, small off-white head. Smell hops and light sweetness. Taste hops, bitter, lightly fruity. Good carbonation, medium body.
Draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Orange amber pour. Orange citrus and Belgian floral yeast in both flavor and aroma. Nice fuller mouthfeel. Orange zest notes. Very drinkable and quite nice

Tap. Orange amber color with a solid creamy head. Honeyed nose with hints of pine wood and maple syrup. The taste is slightly acidic, sweet, hot and hoppy. The bodys medium full, the finish is long. Overall, a nice full-bodied wit.

15cl bottle sample @ Kerstbierfestival 11, Essen.
Orangée brumeuse, col ocre épais.
Arôme rappelle plus une IPA que une blanche, bouquet épicé dhiver, note de pamplemousse et agrumes bien en avant.
En bouche, houblon citrus et autres agrumes, pamplemousse, fini est léger avec un malt en retrait, fleuri presque herbacée allant vers la camomille. Pas mauvaise, mais pour moi, plus une IPA festive.

Large bottle. Aroma dominated by the hops with lots of grass and hay. Slightly unclear orange colour with white head. Spicy flavour with some orange and fresh hops bitterness. Not very Christmaslike but a nice Christmas present.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2012 Bottle @ Bull & Bush Christmas beer tasting. Hazy, golden orange appearance with a white head. Spruce, pine, spicy aroma. Spicy, minty, spruce, piney hoppy, toasty malty, slightly fruity flavor.

Bottle at DØE tasting.
Slight hazy orangey with a very large white head. Aroma heavy hoppy and spicy (dryhopped). Flavor light sweet, medium+ spicy (citrus, orange), heavy bitter. Light body, dry ending, wit-bier? Refreshing, solid hopped.

Tap at Churchkey. Hazy light orange with a diminishing whiter head. Nose is very interesting. Herbs, sage, chamomile. Similar to Stillwater Cellar Door. Nice floral component. Taste is quite nice: big bitterness, lavender, powerful soapy hops. Even sweet orange juice in the nose  Overall great stuff. Doesnt feel like "Christmas ale" which is nice. Super hoppy, nice garden herb character. Yum.

Thanks GT2. Hazy golden pour with a small white head. Crisp nectar fruits and dough with spicy hints lead to lemon and wheat. Medium body with low coronation and a dry crisp finish.

On tap at Orsted Olbar. Hazy amber colour, white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, fruity, pineapple, curacao. Flavour is sweet, malty, caramel, fruity, a bit cloying, light wheat tartness, curacao, mandarines, bitter fruity hoppy finish. Medium bodied. A bit weird, not bad but not exactly to my taste.

Draught at Churchkey. Hazy amber pour with a smallish bubbly white head. Nose holds an interesting combination of citrus hops, grass, and molasses malt that melds with certainly prevalent orange peel and coriander spice; definitely an interesting combo. Flavor is much of the same; the blend of American strong and Belgian wit styles doesnt necessarily work, but it is fairly complex and intriguing if nothing else. Solid.

1.5 l bottle. BBE 15.09.2019. 2009 vintage.

75 cl bottle @ home, BBE 22.08.2018
Had to have a fresh bottle too. And it was rather strong on american hops  and a nice one too. Score estimate: 3.8‐3.9.

Pours orange with a small white head. Aroma has notes of fruits and berries with mild notes of spices. Taste is quite spicy with notes of malts and berries. Finish is slightly spicy and dry. Okay, but probably not quite as good as it would be fresh. 7-3-7-3-14 = 3.4

Re-rated on 24.12.2012, 750ml bottle from Alko. BBE 22/08/18

Pours dark reddish orange with a large foamy head. Aroma of strong stingy floral hops, caramel, toffee, spices and some gooseberries. Taste is strong and hoppy with some caramely notes, spices and malts. Finish is warming and slightly spicy with a strong hoppy bite. 1500 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu, Helsinki. BBE 19.9.2019.
Pours a copper orange colour with a thick white head. Aroma of caramel malts, toffee and grassy hops. Flavour of caramel malts, sweet berries, toffee and quite diminished hops. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a smooth, malty, caramel and bitter hops. This has transformed into a tripel.

Tap pours orange amber, light white head. Smell is sweet and grainy but piney and flowery. Taste is smooth and somewhat simple. A bit of a double ipa character, with creamy feel up front and a solid grain bill, but plenty of pine resins and and grapefruit and lemon citrus kick from hops. Not really crazy just a great solid beer. The finish is grainy and a touch dry with a lasting citrus bitter and fresh pine.

Draft. Pours hazy red with a nice beige head, good retention/lace. Aroma of pine, citrus, spruce/juniper, caramel malt. Taste is quite bitter, very dry, with spruce/pine hops dominating. Produces a very dry bitter sensation on the palate, oily texture, bitter finish. Nice.

Fad: Orange øl med et lille skumhoved. Let diset. Duften er primært citrus med en tand hvede, men ikke meget. Smagen er god men ikke overraskende og ikke nyskabende som man ellers håber i en hybrid. Lidt mere humle end hvede og appelsinen kan man ikke ane. Men god øl er det.

Pretty good beer. Poured from a bottle at a good temperature getting a mammoth, foamy, super frothy, fluffy, billowy, off white, long lasting head and loads of clingy lace. Color is a clear amber with some slow, lazy, large bubble trails. Aroma is  mainly hop and malt. Flavor is hop, malt, some carbonic tang, quite dry. Body is great, ditto carbonation. Finish is like flavor, fairly long, and a hint of alcohol. To me, its a somewhat strong american india pale ale. I dont pick up much spice at all. Good drinking though.

Magnum bottle, I think 1 or 2 years old. Auburn pour with a good amount of beige head. Spiced, and put fruit aroma. Flavor is the same, but the yeast is very strong making the finish somewhat sharp and earthy.

Tap.  Pours hazy ruby with a medium, creamy white head, medium retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is citrus, pine, resin, and spruce hops, light biscuit malt, fruity esters, and spicy alcohol.  Flavor is spicy alcohol, medium malt, heavy hops, moderate bitterness, and a dry finish.  Full body, medium warmth and carbonation.

1.5 liter magnum from Wine and Cheese Place. Shared at Blakes Feast of Friends party. Pours a cloudy red-amber color with a massive off-white head that starts frothy and settles rocky with heavy lace. Aroma of wheat, orange peel, coriander, clove and other spices, Belgian yeast, candi sugar, and mixed fruits. Flavor follows suit for the most part, with plenty of spices, wheat, mixed malts, and fruits. Medium-bodied, with abundant carbonation and a wheaty, spicy mouthfeel. A little muddled but interesting.

On tap. Pours redish orange with off white head. Aroma is sweet rice, almost like rice milk, some milky lacto sweetness, rice pudding, sweet grains, almons, honey, some hops behind and a yeasty feel. Taste is very different. Alot more fresh with hops, citrus and grapefruit bit still the grainy sweetness from the aroma is there underneath.

pours hazy almost murky reddish orange, fluffy head: Aroma: Grain, oats, porridge, risengrød, ricepudding, milky, faint grassy hops, lactose, sweet almonds, orange peel, light yeast, 
taste is a lot different than the aroma, a somewhat big hopkick, compared to what I was expecting, nice bitterness, fruity sweet, marmalade, grassy, orange, orange peel,  almonds, grassy hops, light caramel, tangerine, pine needles, grapefruit, light yeast, faint banana, spiced, coriander, bitter aftertaste, the bitterness stays on your palate for a long time. Funny mix

Sampled at Monks with Andrew and PJ. Pours a hazy amber body with white head. Aroma is caramel malts, light bitter hops, and some alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium with carbonation and notes of bitter floral hops, sweet malts, and rye.
Oh tap at monks cafe.  Rye ale, some caramelized malts,  slight peppercorn.  Some sweet candi sugars and husk.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy, amber with a nice off-white head.. Fair lacing. Nose of carame, citrus, pine and yeast. Medium sweet flavor with caramel, spices, grapefruit and fruits. Medium bodied, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Ends up more dry with some bitterness.
1.5L bottle.  Golden color.  Complex aroma.  Barnyard blankets, spices.  Orange peel.  Very bitter flavor.  Good.
A good christmas beer. Golden redish colour with a creamy head. Nice bitterness and a slight flowery taske.

Appearance: Pours a clouded tan-colored body, the hue of sandalwood, with a foaming, lasting, off-white head.

Smell: Has an earthy, raw "green" hop aroma paired with citrus pith, jagged weeds, savory spices, and more alcohol than is really warranted.

Taste: A fleeting flitter of toasted grains before the tongue is ruthlessly dunked in a vat of citric, astringent juiced citrus fruits, harsh spices, a sharp bitterness, and seemingly more alcohol than the listed 8%. Finishes dry with an enduring coarseness. Some beers really have me wondering if this was what was in intended. This will leave you seeing Red as your face goes White.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation.

Overall: A cruel, mean-spirited brew for the holiday season that was real work finishing what was in my glass (the remainder in the bottle was unceremoniously discarded).

Giant bottle. Thanks Faroeviking and Pinball for the birthday present! It pours hazy golden with a big off white head. The aroma is quite fruity and hoppy with notes of spices, yeast and caramel. The flavour is spicy hopped with notes of fruit, citrus, caramel, spices and passion fruit. Lovely.

Big thanks to yespr for that one. Bottle looks awesome. Beer in the glass very zippy, nice creamy head. Starts strong, modest malty, fine spicy, fruity background. More and more dry, a bit wheaty, finish a bit moldy. Starts really good, finish a bit too dry.

Thanks to Dutchs for the bottle pour. A surprising floral, resin, cannabis hop presence in the nose and on the tongue. Hints of candy sugar and cinnamon to follow. Thankfully not too sweet. As far as Christmas beers go, this one is a keeper.

big 1500ml bottle .. . pours a hazy gold tan .. . great foam- big fluffy head and sticky thick lacing .. . good hop presence- light bark, syrup, yeast and crazy resin .. . pretty good, alot better than i thought it was gonna be .. . all we wanted was a log ride...
Magnum. Pours amber brown. White head. Nose/taste of nutmeg, candi sugar, toffee, cinnamon, spices and mixed nuts. Semi sweet and nutty finish. Medium body.

Amber coloured beer with some light carbonation and an average off-white head. Sharper refreshing citrus fruity grassy hoppy aroma (lemongrass, zest, coriander). Full creamy palate. Finish is sprankling bitter, dry fruity with some hop dry touches. Nice.

Taster from bottle, courtesy of Jackie at the CASK Pub & Kitchen, 1st Nov 2010. Hazy orange. Nose of cough candy and fresh hops. In the mouth, you find citrus flavours locked in a duel with candy sugar. Delightful, definitely need to try this again.
Magnum shared at the 5000 tasting - lots of crystal malts, weedy, grass in the nose. Caramel, piney, meadowy hops with a dry finish. not that impressive, despite the size of the bottle.

In short: An easy to drink beer that is very hoppy (piney) and has an original spicy character. 
How: Bottle 1.5L magnum.  Exact age unknown, probably a little over one after bottling
The look: Cloudy amber body topped by a medium white head leaving good lacings
In long: Nose blends a fun array of spices and plenty of piney resinous hops.  Taste has plenty of grainy slightly toasted malts, orange peels, berries, dry herbal spices, lots of piney hops, hops resin.  Finish is rather dry and the big is quite easy to drink.  I could not really name individual spices but all I can tell is that they were not the usual array of Christmas beer spices (cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, etc.) and it was a just a nice spicy flavor that not only was original but also worked really well with the piney resinous hops.  I really enjoyed that beer.  Very nice Christmas beer.  But I think that Christmas and other holidays should learn from Halloween and encourage women to dress like sluts.

Im Antrunk ist das Bier aromatisch hopfig, natürlich, vielfältig. Der Hopfen weitet sich aber sogar noch aus, dabei nimmt er an Herbe zu und ist so nicht mehr der alleinige Taktgeber. Weniger bitter, auch die Herbe ist im Vergleich zum Hopfen dann doch eher gering. Etwas fruchtig und grasig, zudem sind Honignoten erkennbar. Vollmundig hopfig, im Abgang verfliegt er aber merkwürdig schnell und hinterlässt keine bitteren oder herben Noten, das Bier ist minimal grasig. Ein durch und durch auf den Hopfen ausgelegtes Bier! 12/12/11/12//12

Magnum shared by glouglouburp..
Appearance : Hazy amber with a medium creamy white head.

Aroma : Awesome spices with nice fruits. Herbal hops. Notes of mandarines.

Taste : Great spices with awesome fruity mandarines. Very fresh. Niucely herbal and floral.

Overall : Wow this was very nice. Unique fruity profile mixed with the herbal and floral hops. It was very fresh and very drinkable. Great balance. Didnt really felt the 8% abv. Real nice beer.

My Bottom Line:
Herbs and conifers spice up this festive brews aroma, as rose water, orange zest and cherries slowly step aside for rising resinous hop bitterness. There is a lot going on here, but it is amazingly harmonious and well rendered. 

Further Personal Perceptions:
-Generous foam stays atop the cloudy pale amber.
-Light alcohol burn reminds you that this is not meant to be drunk quickly. The attractive spice and hop combo make you forget about this alcohol though...
-The fluffy, pillowy mouthfeel serves the flavor profile admirably.
-The yeast and base malts add cake flour allusions which are quite pleasant.

From a magnum.

1.5 liter bottle shared at the 5,000 party. Poured a slight hazed amber body under a full foamy light beige head. Aroma of grassy hops, citrus, grains and only a slight hint of sweetness. Smooth body with a medium mouthfeel and average carbonation. Flavor is far far sweeter then the aroma lets on, notes of honey, toast, caramel and fruit. Odd aroma of manure, earth.  The flavor has a dirt like quality, earthy hops, caramel.  Medium in body, smooth mouthfeel.  The finish is earth and metallic hops.  Not horrible, but far from great.  Possible this beer was skunked.  To be fair, I should retry this fresh.

Big monstrous bottle at the double 5k tasting.  Pours a hazey brown with a thin beige head.  Skunky right up front.  Guess that happens when you take a beer, stick it into a green bottle, and sit it on store shelves for over a year.  Oh well.  Spices and wheat beyond the skunk.  Toast, skunk again.  Some spicy hop notes.  Bitter finish.  The skunking really killed this.  Probably a decent beer fresh.  Shame there were no brown 1.5L bottles around when this got bottled up.

Its hazy, orange-golden with a huge, creamy, golden and lasting head. The aroma has notes of fruit, mostly peach and citrus. The flavour has a light sweetness, a refreshing bitterness and notes of fruits like peach, melon, a little oranges and other citrus, and the finish is slightly spicy and dry. The balance is very nice, in the delicious beer. I was fortunate enough to share the 1½ liters with only one other person :)

Bottle shared at Paul and Ryans 5,000th rate tasting. Pours orange amberish with an off white head. Hoppy piney aroma with some light dankish marijuana notes. Well carbonated. Fresh fresh piney hop flavor with some lightly sweet malty notes and some light lemony notes. Pretty good.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2011 Large bottle shared by someone at Paul and Ryans 5000th celebration. Poured a hazy reddish amber with a white head that lasted throughout the beer. Aroma was full of malts with bread, grains and hay coming through as well as a slight fruit note. Flavor was similarly malty with a strong bread note that became a bit sweeter in the finish with some fruit.
Big doughy caramel nose, light citrus. Taste is moderately sweet, lightly better, lots of iced tea, lots of caramel, cookie dough, rather astringent. Bleh.

Pours hazy copper with a large beige head.  The aroma has toasty semi-sweet malt, orange zest, light spice, peaches and British yeastiness showing through and an overall cleanness to it.  Medium body that starts smooth then the carbonation is mouth-filling and frothy giving it a fuller feel.  The flavor starts with the British red ale yeast and sweet toasted malt with some dry fruitiness.  then the orange zest comes in along with earthy hops.  The finish is on the hoppy side.  Nice beer.

1.5L magnum bottle, courtesy dickinsonbeer, consumed relatively fresh in March 2010.  The pour yields a lightly hazy, dark golden-orange body.  A small, bubbly head of beige froth crowns the surface.  Scattered, tiny lacing spots dot the glass.  The nose is very hoppy, showing strong notes of pine resin, grapefruit, and a hint of green grass, all over a creamy malt base of blonde candy, toffee, and light dessert bread.  There are definitely some lactic, wheaty tendencies.  It comes across much like an imperial wheat IIPA.  Flavors are largely the same, with a few variations.  Again very hoppy and resinous, pine pushes forward as the dominant hop characteristic, joined by supporting notes of oily lemon peel and some peppery wildflowers.  Toffee malt is amply sweet, smoothed out by creamed wheat grain, and sporting a bit of mild spicing.  Thankfully, the bready yeast manages to keep things dry enough to avoid any overly cloying, sugar laden tendencies.  Medium-plus in terms of body stature, the palate sports moderate carbonation and a smooth, creamy consistency.  Very nice brew overall.  The balance achieved is remarkable.
